original:
Corporations are generally required to pay taxes similarly to individuals. In certain tax systems, this can lead to double taxation. This occurs when a corporation pays taxes on its profits, and subsequently, when it distributes these profits to its shareholders in the form of dividends, the shareholders must report this income on their personal tax returns, incurring a second layer of income tax.
